(game was finished on 360, only purchased here for DLC)

the dlc is better than the main game but honestly this game pales in comparison to the original game. the presentation, story and characters just arent as engaging. go play the original, and i'd say forget about this, as it taints the experience.

Tá aí um fps elaborado, envolvente e que te motiva pela comoção igual um bom filme. Isso que me faz amar videogames. O jogo simplesmente me colocar dentro desse setup incrível, numa cidade flutuante cheia de mistérios e me deixar quase decidir o futuro de toda aquela gente. captou minha imaginação em 2013, e segue em 2020 me deixando muito feliz! Fica a curiosidade se em Bioshock Infinite, realmente tivemos alguma escolha, já que nosso protagonista me parece imerso num beco sem saída do início ao fim.

Having never played a BioShock game before, I have to say I've thoroughly enjoyed playing the game and working my way through a great story. Slick graphics, some lovely environments and the usual frag fest of weapons and powers. For those that like this type of game and haven't played it, pick it up in a Steam sale and loose yourself in the fight! Enjoy!
чтобы понять сюжет нужно быть физиком-ядерщиком.
Irado
incrivel

I recommend it but there is a lot things that are not good.
Pros
- This is BioShock in its core after all. Good art design and environment
- Very nice graphics even in 2020 when i played it. There are sometimes bad textures but overall sharp and excellent graphics very authentic as previous parts
- Motion capture of Elisabeth is perfect. So much details but after all she is main character so its justified. Nothing more funny when she goes to unlock door with bouncing moves :)

But then the CONS
- Shooting mechanic is simply bad. There is absolutely no rewarding feeling after shoot out. Maybe after bigger challenges later in the game and only in 1999 mode. But even that there is tactic for every encounter to complete easy almost without dying. Exception is that Siren -.- but there is tactic for her also i just realized it in 2nd playthrough. 
- Story is 2nd. Its starts excellent with slow narrative and solid background but then goes into infinite literally and you lose track of it in the middle almost.
- Characters except Elisabeth are complete crap honestly. There is no single new unique character that can remain in memory. Comparing to BioShock 1 this is small child game character based.
- Even if design is nice and graphics there are no unique locations all are visually similar and not unique.

Overall its nice game but its not masterpiece like BioShock 1 in any way. Even if i don't compare it to any game and you play it without previous experience this game is not exactly something you should admire really.
Kupiłem tą grę na przecenie myślałem że mnie nie wciągnie.Początek gry był przeciętny ale potem akcja się zajebiście rozkręca.

I love this game. Awesome Graphics, Nice Story, Nice Gameplay....Just One complain about the weapons..I need more weapon slot more than 2 and also want some heavy weapons..finish the game in 11 hour gameplay...

Bioshock Infinite is pretty good game even though it has problems. 

I like the Elizabeth and Booker Dewitt as characters. The chemistry between them works very well. Also I like the idea behind the skylines.

There are issues though with the game and they are related to story and various design decisions. The story has a lot of holes in it and in the end doesn't really make sense. The whole idea about parallel worlds is interesting but needs to be done well. Unfortunately here it really isn't. Most of the stuff just simply has to be accepted. If you start asking questions you won't get a lot of (good) answers.

Also there is one boss in the later parts of the game (a certain lady) that is just frustrating especially on higher difficulties. If that boss is not rushed down quickly through pretty cheesy tactics it can cause a lot of headaches as it can revive a lot of enemies around you, is quite a the bullet sponge and can regenerate health while being pretty quick to get away. In general some the enemy encounters seem to be designed just around quantity instead of quality.

Anyway I still enjoy the game for what it is. I'm still sad though that we never got the game that was initially shown in the trailers as the story seemed to be more interesting there...

一句话总结：我永远喜欢伊丽莎白！!
     很久前打折的时候入合集，前两部在早就通关了，这部《生化奇兵：无限 》在我的库里尘封了很久，疫情期间终于解封了。
     太长时间不玩第一人称游戏，边吐边玩，近30小时才体验完所有一周目内容，但优秀的故事和伊丽莎白仍是我继续的动力（主要是伊丽莎白）
没想到我一个成年人会对一名游戏角色心动，话说又有谁不会为她心动呢？！当她在沙滩上跳舞，在地下室里唱歌的时候，就像 是我小时候看的迪士尼公主，美丽大方、机智勇敢、充满人情味，更重要的是她不拖后腿！她会帮你捡道具，帮你开锁，或者配合场景做出有趣的反应，她不仅仅只是个工具人或推动剧情的npc。我相信任何人在医院里听见伊丽莎白撕心裂肺的惨叫后还会闲庭信步，哪怕是我这种“三光”政策玩家，也会放弃找录音机，咒骂杂兵挡路去救她。毫无疑问，她就是这部作品的灵魂。
我女儿真好看
如果你还在考虑，我可以负责任告诉你本体＋海葬DLC必买作品。

[No Spoilers Section]

I'm going to be an outlier and say this game is not nearly as good as it's made out to be except in the boss-shooter and platforming areas. The story is incoherent and riddled with inconsistencies. While it starts out okay it rapidly becomes tedious and many of the sections are simply shoot-fests. The method of story development is a mix of new and legacy methods from earlier Bioshock products that make zero sense in the new setting. The survival resources management, weapon upgrade crafting and scavenging have also been bolted onto the new setting that makes little sense. Finally the grand finale reveal that the story builds up to is actually the reverse of what should happen which is a bit of a downer, not in an emotional sense but on an intellectual level.

It is a very attractive game, the sidekick is well rounded and well developed with good emotional development but the presentation lets down that work. The characters are cardboard cutouts that have none of the humanity of earlier characters such as Ryan or Atlas.

There is no real stealth mechanic until Bioshock Infinite: Burial at Sea pt2 and even there it's not as good as say Deus Ex: Mankind Divided as an example, however that [articular DLC is a dedicated stealth episode and should and could have been done better

The game is more gonzo in the action and platforming aspects which is okay when you become used to it however it never approaches the level desperate fighting found in the earlier products, instead getting killed is just annoying and tedious.
The combat is very 'samey' and goes on for far too long, many players find that they only use two weapons rather than a mix for all purposes. In the Burial at Sea DLC the scarcity of ammunition forces you to use a slightly greater mix of weapons but that simply feels forced. The weapons have none of the beauty of the strange additions to the Bioshock weapons, upgrades in Bioshock: Infinite make no visible differences, and if you drop a weapon and pick it up later it magically has the same upgrades. It's slightly jarring which takes you out of the story. The combat is a different feel and this will depend on the player's preference but the sliding on rails thing got old quite quickly.

[Spoilers Section.]

- The ending is disappointing, and I say this as someone who counts "Angel Heart" as one of their favourite movies. Dewitt gets killed by the rather facile horde of Elizabeths at his decision point in his life where in another dimension he becomes Comstock, the evil antagonist for the game. However he is killed where the actual Dewitt you play *renounced* becoming the bad guy and living with his guilt, so in effect he's being punished for doing the right thing and then going through hell and developing a character arc to save Elizabeth. 
Also, the choice of the baptism is odd (I'm an atheist so I'm not saying this on religious grounds) because surely the time to intervene with Dewitt would be *before* he gives away Anna and therefore none of the choices can be made, or even before Wounded Knee or The Boxer Rebellion where Dewitt does the terrible things that haunts him his whole life. This glaringly obvious mistake spoiled the whole game for me and ruined the development of the character. I fully understand the sidekick is the actual protagonist in the game, not the player, but this silliness was really annoying.
- Voxophones, the equivalent of the legacy audio diary logs from Bioshock, make no sense in the setting and there seems to be no reason for them to be recorded for most of them. In Rapture everyone is an egotist and making these audionotes makes sense but in Columbia everyone, even the very poor, seems to have the money to make these things even if they can't afford food. They often serve no purpose than exposition and it feels artificial.

最近突然想玩点FPS游戏，就在库里看了看，正好这个b.....开头的游戏排在前列，就下了玩了。上空岛的时候在思考这游戏中文译名是啥，结果把生化奇兵和夺宝奇兵（原谅我没看过XD）搞混了，就一直想要靠游戏内容辨别出来。
当我剧情还没开始却已经从教堂里搜刮到36个银币时：这肯定是夺宝奇兵！
当我喝到第一口摄魂迷心后：好吧，看来是生化奇兵......
当我尝试着用摄魂迷心控制售货机而它吐出一坨银币时——
这！就是夺宝奇兵！

Bioshock Infinite presenta una ambientación, banda sonora e historia únicas, sin embargo, su jugabilidad no logra estar a la altura. Se queda como un shooter por arenas con pequeñas posibilidades de investigación, por lo que la serie Bioshock todavía nos queda debiendo un apartado que le haga justicia al universo que concibe Irrational en cada entrega.

The game was terrific, I especially loved the voice acting.  The only thing I didn't like was the grind in Clash in the Clouds,

If I started the dlc with the infusions and gear, or had a choice of those from the base game, then I would have really liked it.  But it forced me to grind for gear, upgrades and infusions, which wouldn't be so bad if the prices were lower.

The thing that stopped me from playing CitC was not being able to start from a wave just for the Blue Ribbon.  There are too many games for me to play to care about that headache.

TLDR:  Base game and Burial at Sea 1 and 2 were fantastic, especially BS2 with 1998 stealth mode.  CitC is good for people who like to grind, hell it might even be a good place to start before the game to learn mechanics and combinations.

Un juego hermoso con una historia muy bien desarrollada y una jugabilidad muy buena. Lo que más resalta de este juego es su arte y originalidad, sin duda una obra maestra. Indispensable en tu biblioteca de videojuegos.
